title: India-Canada Ties Hit New Low: Timeline Of How Relations Soured
content: The India-Canada relations nosedived after Justin Trudeau said last year that there was credible intelligence linking India's government to the killing of Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar.
summary: The India-Canada relations nosedived after Justin Trudeau said last year that there was credible intelligence linking India's government to the killing of Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar.

title: Nijjar Killing, Bishnoi Gang, Trade Talks: How India-Canada Relations Soured
content: India-Canada diplomatic ties soured further this week after allegations by Canadian federal police that "agents" of Delhi are working with organised criminals to "target (the) South Asian community... specifically pro-Khalistani elements" there.
summary: India-Canada diplomatic ties soured further this week after allegations by Canadian federal police that "agents" of Delhi are working with organised criminals to "target (the) South Asian community... specifically pro-Khalistani elements" there.

title: "Over $1000 Trillion": Elon Musk On Cost Of Building A City On Mars
content: "To build a city on Mars that can grow by itself likely requires at least a million tons of equipment, which would therefore require >$1000 trillion," Elon Musk, SpaceX CEO wrote on X (formerly Twitter).
summary: "To build a city on Mars that can grow by itself likely requires at least a million tons of equipment, which would therefore require >$1000 trillion," Elon Musk, SpaceX CEO wrote on X (formerly Twitter).

title: La Nina Less Likely, Will Be Weak And Short Lived If It Comes
content: The likelihood of a La Nina weather event in coming months has decreased, Australia's weather bureau said, adding that if the phenomenon did appear, it would be weak and short-lived.
summary: The likelihood of a La Nina weather event in coming months has decreased, Australia's weather bureau said, adding that if the phenomenon did appear, it would be weak and short-lived.

title: North Korea Blows Up Roads Connecting It To The South
content: North Korea on Tuesday blew up sections of the deeply symbolic roads connecting it to the South, Seoul's military said, adding it had conducted a "counter-fire" operation in response.
summary: North Korea on Tuesday blew up sections of the deeply symbolic roads connecting it to the South, Seoul's military said, adding it had conducted a "counter-fire" operation in response.

title: Brazil Woman Becomes A Cop To Avenge Father's Murder, Arrests The Killer
content: The cop admitted to fantasising about the day her father's killer would serve his sentence behind bars.
summary: The cop admitted to fantasising about the day her father's killer would serve his sentence behind bars.

title: "Bishnoi Gang Linked To Indian Government Agents": Canada Cops' Claim
content: Canada's Royal Canadian Mounted Police claimed that "agents of the Government of India" use criminals - referring specifically to the Bishnoi gang - to "target (the) South Asian community... specifically pro-Khalistani elements" in that country.
summary: Canada's Royal Canadian Mounted Police claimed that "agents of the Government of India" use criminals - referring specifically to the Bishnoi gang - to "target (the) South Asian community... specifically pro-Khalistani elements" in that country.

title: NASA Filmmaker Claims Evidence Of Alien Life Could Be Revealed Next Month
content: The filmmaker claimed that insiders from the Breakthrough Listen project tipped him off that concrete evidence may be revealed within a month, possibly coinciding with the US election.
summary: The filmmaker claimed that insiders from the Breakthrough Listen project tipped him off that concrete evidence may be revealed within a month, possibly coinciding with the US election.

title: British Influencer, 26, Dies While Trying To Climb Spain's Highest Bridge
content: The unidentified influencer fell while climbing the cable-stayed bridge in Talavera de la Reina, approximately 70 miles southwest of Madrid.
summary: The unidentified influencer fell while climbing the cable-stayed bridge in Talavera de la Reina, approximately 70 miles southwest of Madrid.

title: Global Public Debt To Hit Record $100 Trillion: International Monetary Fund
content: Global public debt is expected to reach a record $100 trillion this year, the IMF said, warning that the fiscal outlook for many countries may even be "worse than expected."
summary: Global public debt is expected to reach a record $100 trillion this year, the IMF said, warning that the fiscal outlook for many countries may even be "worse than expected."

title: Japan Election Campaigns Kick Off
content: Japan Elections: Key issues include price rises, regional security, and disquiet over scandals in Ishiba's Liberal Democratic Party.
summary: Japan Elections: Key issues include price rises, regional security, and disquiet over scandals in Ishiba's Liberal Democratic Party.

title: Will Not Hit Iran's Nuclear Or Oil Facilities, Israel Assures US: Report
content: Israel has assured the White House that a planned retaliatory attack on Iran won't target nuclear or oil facilities, US media reported Monday.
summary: Israel has assured the White House that a planned retaliatory attack on Iran won't target nuclear or oil facilities, US media reported Monday.

title: Taiwan Detects Record 153 Chinese Military Aircraft After Drills
content: Taiwan detected a record 153 Chinese military aircraft around the self-ruled island, official data showed after China held a day of large-scale drills.
summary: Taiwan detected a record 153 Chinese military aircraft around the self-ruled island, official data showed after China held a day of large-scale drills.

title: "Silky" Patrols Waters To Save Sharks In Colombian Pacific
content: A lone catamaran named "Silky" patrols waters around the remote island of Malpelo, a protected refuge yet full of peril for endangered marine species in the Colombian Pacific.
summary: A lone catamaran named "Silky" patrols waters around the remote island of Malpelo, a protected refuge yet full of peril for endangered marine species in the Colombian Pacific.

title: Trudeau Doubles Down On Charges After India-Canada Diplomatic Showdown
content: Canada Prime Minister Justin Trudeau doubled down on accusations of India "supporting criminal activity against Canadians", as the two countries expel six diplomats each in the row over the killing of terrorist Hardeep Singh NIjjar.
summary: Canada Prime Minister Justin Trudeau doubled down on accusations of India "supporting criminal activity against Canadians", as the two countries expel six diplomats each in the row over the killing of terrorist Hardeep Singh NIjjar.

title: Only A Third Of Europe's Surface Water In Good Health: Environment Agency
content: Pollution, habitat degradation, climate change and over-use of freshwater resources are putting a strain on Europe, the European Environment Agency warned.
summary: Pollution, habitat degradation, climate change and over-use of freshwater resources are putting a strain on Europe, the European Environment Agency warned.

title: "Our Territories Not For Sale": Indigenous Groups In Brazil On Carbon Credits
content: Indigenous organizations in the Brazilian state of Para said they were not consulted by the government before it signed a deal with multinational companies to sell carbon offset credits to support conservation of the Amazon rainforest in the state.
summary: Indigenous organizations in the Brazilian state of Para said they were not consulted by the government before it signed a deal with multinational companies to sell carbon offset credits to support conservation of the Amazon rainforest in the state.

title: Facebook, Instagram Face Widespread Outage In US, Thousands Affected
content: Meta Platforms' Facebook and Instagram were down for thousands of users in the U.S. on Monday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.
summary: Meta Platforms' Facebook and Instagram were down for thousands of users in the U.S. on Monday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.

title: Israel PM Vows "Merciless Strikes" On Hezbollah, Including Beirut
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday vowed to strike Hezbollah without mercy following a deadly drone strike on a military base in Israel, and retaliation would extend to targets in Beirut.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday vowed to strike Hezbollah without mercy following a deadly drone strike on a military base in Israel, and retaliation would extend to targets in Beirut.

title: Climate Change Could Reduce Amazon's Methane Absorbtion By 70%: Study
content: Extreme temperatures and humidity driven by climate change could reduce the Amazon rainforest's capacity to absorb the greenhouse gas methane by 70 per cent, a study has found.
summary: Extreme temperatures and humidity driven by climate change could reduce the Amazon rainforest's capacity to absorb the greenhouse gas methane by 70 per cent, a study has found.
